drupalNodeEvent.title: The Importance of Student Interchange in a Post-COVID World

field_speakers.processed: Peggy Blumenthal (IIE), Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States of America Educational Affairs Office

field_organizers.processed: US Heartland China Association, International Student Conferences, IIE, Embassy of the People's Republic of China in the United States of America

field_description.processed:
Join USHCA next month for an engaging Zoom webinar where we will be discussing "The Importance of Student Interchange in a Post-COVID World", co-hosted by International Student Conferences.

This student event will feature unique insights from students in our community as well as select perspectives from representatives in international education policy to facilitate dialogue on the realities of U.S.-China student interchange. The webinar will also feature firsthand experiences from leaders in USHCA Student Programs and the 4th China-America Student Conference. Register now to not miss this informative discussion on shaping the future of international education and cultural exchange!
